Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money and start to search for other hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArtursLi
Reviews.Content: Terrible, worst experience I ever had. Hotel pictures are at least 15 years old. Noisy, small rooms, breakfast is really bad.......

Reviews.Title: “A bit tatty around the edges...”
Reviews.Author: ScubaSuzie1
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a three-night stay in Barcelona and chose the Hotel Santa Marta after cancelling a previous booking elsewhere due to reading on Trip Advisor someone had experienced bed bugs! Luckily this hotel didn't have this problem, it was just a little bit tatty. The website said it had been recently refurbished... well, I'd like to know how many years ago! Yes, the room doors were fairly new and inside the room the headboard and furniture were relatively new, but it stopped there. The bathroom was VERY tatty, the shower in particular was very old, the tiles were old and the grouting a bit dirty, the shower curtain was too small and didn't fit the opening. The tiled floor in the bedroom wasn't particularly clean so I felt the need to wear slippers when walking around the room - although this wasn't easy in the tiny space available! I'd read previous comments about the rooms being small, but thought I could cope with that for three days. The room literally has barely enough space to walk around the beds. All the bedroom pictures on the website show 'stretched' images to make the rooms look bigger. My suitcase wouldn't fit underneath the table where the old style TV sits, so I had to move the seat from under the dressing table to fit my case there. There was also a patch of mould on the wall under the air-conditioning unit, not very attractive. The hallway was also tatty, the plaster around the lift area had been knocked off over the years and never tidied up. There is no WiFi as mentioned on their website. I enquired at reception and was told I would have to buy a Telefonica card for 24 hours for 12 euros which would start as soon as I started using it and couldn't be switched on and off. The signal apparently doesn't always work so the reception don't offer it. I told them they should remove it from their website but they couldn't see anything wrong with leaving it on there. The cafeteria/breakfast room is not worth paying a visit. The charge was 6 euros for breakfast which included 1 coissant, 1 bread role, 1 glass of orange juice and 1 cup of coffee from a vending machine. Across the main road there was a very nice cafe which served a similar breakfast (waiter service) for 4.70 euros!

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: smittyba
Reviews.Content: We had to sit on the bed while the other moved in room. No where to put your suitcases. Floors were not cleaned the 3 days we where stayed. Breakfast available but only 2 rolls and drink. Staff helpful except the bald fellow that didn't want to be asked any questions since he "was busy". Not in the best location for women to stay as it is in alley off the main area. We made sure to get back early but alley did have street lights. Beds OK, make sure to take your adapters or out of luck. would not stay there again. our room was across from the lift and heard everyone coming since walls are so thin. did allow us to get into room earlier than time allowed since we got off a cruise ship early morning. the taxi driver couldn't find the place since he had never heard of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small but clean room”
Reviews.Author: mini_doll
Reviews.Content: The location was great. Very clsoe to the subway and walking distance to the Ramblas/ restuarant strip in Barcelonetta/dockyard. The staff was friendly, free seasonal fruit was offered at the reception. The room was very small but clean. The tv didn't include any channels in English. No wi-fi (even with payment) available in the room. But god value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you can get it cheap!”
Reviews.Author: SimonBrumUK
Reviews.Content: The Good: This hotel is in a great location on a quiet back street next to Estacio de Franca. It's less than a minute to walk to Barceloneta Metro station and is convenient for the City and the sea front. The popular Born area is just across the road (full of cafes and bars and a stones throw from the Picasso museum) as is the Park and Zoo. If you're travelling on a budget, you can often get this hotel for 50euros a night - good for a hotel in BCN. The Bad: The hotel is very tired. The rooms are very, very small with drab decoration and faded fabrics. The ensuites are little bigger than a wardrobe and the walls (as is often the case in hotels) are very thin - a nightmare if you get noisy neighbours. My Experience: I've stayed here twice now - the first time with no issues at all aside from a tempremental key card! My most recent visit was blighted by noisy neighbours who would return in the early hours and make as much noise as possible. The check in has been smooth and friendly and the accommodation has met my basic needs for a place to wash and sleep. In conclusion, if your needs are basic, you're on a budget and prefer a hotel over a hostal then this hotel could be for you - provided you don't pay over the odds. However, If you like to spend time in your hotel room and have exacting standards, push the budget and look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great positioned budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnE312659
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here each Feb for the last 5 years when I attend a conference in Barcelona. You get what you pay for, budget, small but clean rooms with thin walls which do let in noise although I have never been bothered by this. This hotel is about position. The beach spots are 10min walk away and Las Ramblas is 7min in the other direction. The hotel is on the harbour with great nightlife and eating all around it. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical 2 star”
Reviews.Author: Cardie51
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect. Felt like Alice in Wonderland in the small twin room and the very narrow corridors. We were next to the lift which is not perfect. Walls are paper thin and every sound could be heard. Would not wish to stay in high season as the noise would be dreadful. Waitress on the first morning very sour but other staff were fine. Very clean and fresh towels every day. You get what you pay for and it did not spoil our fantastic week-end away.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: FMCCLX
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. After arriving with my girlfriend to Barcelona we headed to the hotel (Gallardo group). Here is a brief description of the experience: 1) As we arrived there the manager told us that the floors were being painted, and that we could not stay at that hotel. He was actually saying "don't worry we will find you something nice" or "no te preocupes te voy a correr una habitacion muy buena". The guy was a joke. Does he think that other people are dum? Why didn't they told us that when we booked the hotel or why were we allowed to book that hotel 2 weeks before? 2) The abovementioned manager told us that we could have a room at another hotel - named Suisso. He actually tod us that it was just a 5 minute stroll. It turned out to be a 20 minute walk... 3) As we arrived at that hotel the manager told us that there were no rooms available only some apartments in a nearby building. The apartment that we got was clean but old, weird - the walls were painted in shades of grey, and poorly isolated as we heard everything from the streets (calle). Moreover, that building had no security and was always busy, with a lot of strange people getting in all the time. To be honest it seemed as if it had a brothel (cathouse) on one of the floors. And it was not really an aprtment as it had no kitchen. In conclusion the hotel experience was a total scam. I think that these gentlemen’s should be banned from the hotel business. It was a pity because we liked Barcelona – you should try the tapas of Ski Bar at Via (calle) Layetana.

Reviews.Title: “More of a hostel than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlerussell
Reviews.Content: Although this is at the budget end of the Barcelona price range, this was still a very basic hotel for the money and star rating. The room was small, and although it was clean, there was an awful smell continuously coming from the drains in the ensuite. Breakfast was minimal, and the customer service at the front desk varied enormously depending on which member of staff was there. The hotel's checking out procedures are rather strange. Instead of an invoice, I was presented with a credit card receipt for the room as they'd already withdrawn the funds from my account - timestamped at 3am that morning. On getting home, I found that this amount had been withdrawn from my account three times (I stayed two nights). No amount of phoning and emailing the hotel would get them to respond to this. It was only when I complained to activehotels - who I had booked through - that they refunded the money. On the plus side - good location next to Estacion de Francia.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best thing about this place”
Reviews.Author: corkford
Reviews.Content: OK, It was a 2 star hotel so I wasn't expecting much. Firstly, the staff at reception were so rude, it doesn't cost anything to be polite. Having said that the cleaning staff were lovely. Few other problems, I had to ask for elevator to be turned on( receptioniat was none too helpful - If you don't speak fluent spanish he'll be annoyed so don't bother even making the effort to speak your basic spanish as I did as it will not be appreciated). The way to my room was blocked with bags of laundry, my room card consistently failed requiring yet another trip to reception -ugh. The room itself was basic and small but wasn't expecting much else really. Although I have complemented the location you'd really be better off paying a small bit more and going somewhere decent. This place wasn't worth the small amount of money I saved.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Dlucic
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly stuff, check if your door card works before you climb to room, breakfast is two croissant , butter, marmalade, coffee and juice. the best location for exploring Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok”
Reviews.Author: auds06
Reviews.Content: the twin room was very small, more like a single. we were in room 503 right opposite the lift so very noisy, the walls are very thin too. It takes about 15 minutes to walk to the rambla once you know where you are going. staff seemed friendly enough, no kettle etc in the room. for the money it was ok but its very basic, it served the purpose of our visit

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs galore”
Reviews.Author: dubonic11
Reviews.Content: I awoke on my second morning at the Santa Marta Hotel itching all over my arms and torso. Soon afterward, I had red welts popping up everywhere. The man working the front desk played dumb, insisting that I had mosquito bites, was unhelpful and rude. He refused a refund, and I heard him insisting on the phone to his superiors that I was bitten by mosquitoes (which I certainly had not been, since I still have the remnants of the bites weeks later). As if the guy running this roach motel had never seen bed bug bites before!! The rooms themselves are dingy, drab, TINY, they stunk and there were holes in the walls. The only thing to recommend this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “location super the rest not so much”
Reviews.Author: RapeTuke
Reviews.Content: well, yes it is a two star place, so no shocks there. The first receptionist spoke good English and was very helpful, showed us a good pizza place close by. Our room was on 6th floor which was nice, it was quiet but on two occations the elevator didn't work so it was quite challenging to drag my spouse with walking disabilities up to the 6th floor. What I disliked the most was the cigarette smoke EVERYWHERE, even in the breakfast room ( the breakfast room staff wasn't very friendly) and I found a bug on my pillow one night...The ceiling was falling down in pieces, evidently there was no water insulation between the bathroom and the bedroom. All the other buildings in the block are under renovation- <Hopefullly they'll fix Santa Marta as well, the location between the beach and the old town is great. Too bad that there is not a direct train connection from the airport anymore, the station is right next to the hotel but taking the train needs some street smarts on the way since you have to change trains uptown. The taxi to the airport ,on a quiet morning , was about 25 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal situation - at £67 per night reasonable value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Badock
Reviews.Content: Booking the Hotel Santa Marta was a caluculated risk. Next door to a large station, 50 metres from a main thoroughfare, reviewed as basic, clean accommodation we had no illusions. The welcome and assistance from hotel staff was excellent. The rooms are very small but clean - and yes, it does have the air of a place that has seen better days. Breakfast is unvaried but sufficient. However the plus side is considerable. It is bang in the right place to catch a tourist bus, less than 3 minutes' walk to a metro, within 10 minutes of the Barri Gotic, Las Ramblas, the harbourside and its mass of wonderful restaurants and a terrific 15 minute evening stroll away from the beach. We will certainly go back and enjoy another short break using the Santa Marta. For the rpice it is wonderful value - but be prepared for some noise from the station in the early mornings - there are no trains between 000:00hrs and 06:00hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't swing a cat!!”
Reviews.Author: spudly187
Reviews.Content: Me and a mate stayed here for a long weekend. Now we only used it to get our heads down for a few hours and have a shower so wasn't that bothered about the size. Just thought I would warn people who like their hotel to be a bit bigger. On arrival we opened the room door to find a space so small it was suprising. You could just about open the door without hitting the beds!!!! There was no room to walk around the beds as they were so close together. Now this didn't bother me and my friend as like i said we were out and about more than in the hotel but the bathroom was a complete joke! It was so small that the door opened into the main room. You couldn't sit on the toilet properly as it was too close to the wall which meant you had to sit on it sideways but you were met by the sink that was right next to it! The bath was about two foot long (Seriously not joking!!) so it was a very deep tray for the shower i think!! No ventilation so when you showered you couldn't see anything in the room! (I nearly fell over a few times trying to get out without hitting the sink or toilet!!) The only good thing about this hotel was that it was cheap and in a reasonable location. Just thought I would warn people of the size of the room before booking this hotel, but if you don't mind that sort of thing like myself and my friend then you maybe ok with this place but you have been warned!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No, no, no do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: RedBelfast
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked the Hotel Oasis for 8 people but on arrival were sent round the corner to Santa Marta supposedly because the rooms were wirthout electricity etc. The word dump came to mind as we were thrown the keys to our rooms by someone who definately had not graduated from charm school and watched a drunk being manhandled into the lift. The room was...... very small with a double shower - if you consider that sitting on the loo while another person showers beside you constitutes a double shower. Next morning in the breakfast room while eagerly anticipating our wizen apples and tough croissant our friend had her handbag stolen. Were the management interested?.........of course not.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: catialisboa
Reviews.Content: I was scary when i read the reviews here, but when i arrive at the hotel i was very happy... The rooms are small but very cmfortable, the meals aren´t expensive, excelent location. Me and my boyfriend liked very much of hotel Marta and i recomend it for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: tribey
Reviews.Content: Having been to Barcelona before and stayed in a plush hotel, my friend and I decided to return on a very tight budget. We were expecting the worst, given that it only cost us £26 per night. However we were pleasantly surprised. On arrival in the room (3rd floor), it was tiny, nowhere to store suitcases etc and the bed was literally against the door (to open the door you had to pull the sheets onto the bed). It was, however, very clean. The sheets perfectly white, and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was again tiny, but very clean. It wasn't luxurious by any standard, but keps very clean and the staff were very helpful (except the moody ones in the bar). The location of the hotel was perfect. Slap bang in the middle of Ramblas (for day time) and Port Olympic (for bars restaurants clubs etc), just a 15 min walk to both (or a 5 Euro taxi ride) Overall for the money we paid it was excellent value. I will be coming to Barcelona again in March and will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Natmak
Reviews.Content: We stayed there two nights, excellent location, the hotel right next to both train station and metro, 10 mins walks to las rambla, room is clean and good size. The only thing I would complaint is the air condition, it was switching on and off every 5 mins, very noisy when we sleep and not cool when you awake, that's really bother me so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awful room”
Reviews.Author: linztripper
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here last year and had a good experience - clean room, helpful staff etc. This year the room was awful, dark smelly, dank and tiny. We were on honeymoon and it really spoilt the experience. We'll go back to Barcelona but not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: amyrobbo1985
Reviews.Content: On a positive note the hotel rooms were cleaned every day and it is in a central area to all the districts of Barcelona- the beach is a 10-15 mins walk away- this is where the positive comments end. Having read reviews prior to my stay I knew that rooms were going to be on the small side but I did not realise how small, also the bathroom was very long and narrow, and it smelt of sewerage. The wardrobes are really tiny so not good if you take lots of things and there wasn’t enough space to store the suitcases anywhere so we had to put them on the floor at night and on the beds in the day time. I had booked two rooms as we were going for a friends hen party (there were 4 females), when we checked in we were given rooms on different floors even though we requested that they be near each other, when we asked if we could have rooms near each other the man on reception became rude and nasty with us stating that we had made 2 separate bookings when I had in fact booked and paid for the rooms in one transaction. We let this go and went to our separate rooms not wanting anything to ruin our holiday. At 2 o clock in the morning (the first night) a strange man came into my friend’s room whilst they were both asleep- luckily the light from the hall woke them up and he disappeared (one benefit of small rooms) a few minutes later a psycho woman next door started shouting and swearing, she turned her TV up full and started banging on their wall continuously. Both of my friends were really shook up- 1st from the strange man then from the bizarre behaviour of this woman. They both had to seek refuge in mine and my sisters room (four woman in 2 single beds) none of us slept for the rest of the night. First thing in the morning we went down and complained to a different man on reception- he didn’t seem bothered/ worried by the fact that a strange man was able to get into my friends room (the hotel use room cards) and he offered us no explanation as to how this was even possible. At first he tried telling us that they couldn’t have a new room even though we said that they did not feel safe in that room. When he realised that we weren’t going to let the matter drop he made some phone calls and offered my friends a room on the same floor as my room. Their new room was twice the size of their old room. After this we were very wary and hired a safe- not wanting to take any chances. The breakfast itself consisted of fruit juice, tea or coffee and a croissant which is ok if you're not a big eater. As we had paid for bed and breakfast we expected a better breakfast as this was the only meal we were paying for. Barcelona itself is a lovely city with something for everyone, so don’t let this review put you off the city- just the hotel was bad. It definitely isn’t suited to a group of young women.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty shabby”
Reviews.Author: faithfull
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Barcelona which was a great city.Let down by the hotel.Expect a 2* to be pretty basic but really think this one could do with a complete refurbishement.Smelly drains.very shabby rooms,lights hanging off the wall & stained bed covers.Night time was a fight with the mossies & the walls are paper thin!Breakfast uneatable - a sweet roll & a croissant left on a plate - the later apparentely tasted as if it had been coated in meat fat.Bar would be ok I suppose as long as you like it smokey.Not that good value compared to what you get for one more *** Good places to eat although expect to pay a lot for beers - and we are used to high prices !! Will return but not to the SM

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: karibuni73
Reviews.Content: I have spent one week in barcelona with a friend. The santa marta is a very old hotel with no comforts. I was on the 6th floor (there is the lift). The room was very small. No space for the bags.Air conditioning. No hairdryier in the bath (shower and bathtube). The windows were broken. the breakfast was not good but eatable. BUT the room had been cleaned every day and the hotel is only 15-20 minutes to the Cathedral and Rambla (by FOOT) and near the port. So you don't need to take the underground! bUT Underground station was just around the corner (BARCELONETA) as the train station Estacio de França For me was great. Not too noisy. If you are not interested in luxury hotel the santa marta is perfect

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and kind of cheerful”
Reviews.Author: ADSH
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews I was a bit worried about this hotel, but chose it because it was close to the Barcelonetta beaches. I was really pleased when I saw the room, OK so it was tiny, but it was very clean (as if it had just been renovated). It had a new TV and a bright orange David Lynch style telephone. It didn't smell or anything. You can hear people talking, but I stayed during the week so I guess it was quieter, so I had no problems with this. Breakfast is crap - but there are lots of other options nearby. The staff were not particularly friendly - I asked if I could stay another night because I had underbooked a night in BCN but the guy just said they are "very full". So, it's a great location, it's cheap and my room was clean and decent enough. Oh yeah and I walked into my room once and found a huge pair of men's underpants on the floor. It was a bit of a shock, but I guess the cleaner had dug them out from under the bed or something. So the hotel has some comedy value as well.

Reviews.Title: “Aviod like the plague”
Reviews.Author: F0wler
Reviews.Content: Please think twice before booking this hotel. We arrived in the beautiful city of Barcelona, and took a cab to the hotel, It took 2 hours to get checked in, and when we finally got to our room, I could of cried. The room stank, there was actual sick over walls, blood in the bed, the loo hadn't been cleaned from the previous guests, The lamps were hanging off the walls, you could see the wires hanging out, it was just horrid. We went to the reception to complain, and the chap at the desk decided he couldnt speak any English - even though he had perfect English when we checked in! Anyway, when we started to raise our voices, he said someone would come and clean the room, so we headed into Barcelona to start our holiday whist they cleaned the crap up. After a long day of sighseeing, and eating Tapas, we headed back to our room, and there was a hole in the door, and the room had been broken into, they stole my boyfriends shoes, my coat, sunglasses, makeup, toiletries, even my pj's!! basically everything that wasnt in our suitcases, We ran to reception to report this, and there was another couple there who had had money and passports stolen, again, the guy behind reception decided he couldnt understand us, and couldnt speak any English. The 4 of us then went to the Police Station to report the crime, The Police were brill and took the details, and said that they would come to the hotel the next day to look around, I must say, I was a bit scared to stay there that night, I would of loved to of checked out that night, and found another hotel, but my boyf pursuaded me to stay, : ( Anyway, the police came round the next day, and they even took photo's of our room, to be honest, I think this had happened before at this hotel. On another night, we were off out, and opened the lift door, just about to step in, and the electric went off, we were in complete darkness, OMG, we could of been in that blooming lift! So, basically, what I'm trying to say, please please try and find a different hotel to stay in, Barcelona is a fab city, I cant wait to go back, but I will steer clear from this [--]! xcuse my french!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: elsen
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, do not get scared by other peoples stories! Me and my boyfriend stayed there for almost a week and it was above our expectations! I got really worried by reading the rewievs on this site but for a two stars hotel it was very clean, good service and safe.The location to the beach was great, just five minutes and about 15 min walk to las ramblas. We stayed there for 395 euro for 5 nights and i would definitely stay there again and recommed this hotel to my friends! I booked this hotel with yeego.com, no problems!

Reviews.Title: “What's the problem??”
Reviews.Author: BexPebble
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of the hotel I was very nervous, the upside being I was plesently surprised on arrival! Firstly do not follow the hotel's instructions to get to the hotel by train from the airport-this involves 3 train and metro changes when actually the train from the airport goes every half hour to the estacio de franca which is right outside the hotel! so so easy and costs only 2.50 euros. Check in was easy, didnt even have to speak really, were just handed key! Room was very tiny, but modern, clean and bright with a little balcony overlooking a very cute square. Beds were fine, shower good and room cleaned and towels changed every day by truly lovely staff. Some rooms are situated arund a square landing and others off a corridor. Ours was on a corridor which meant there were noises from the corridor (but thats probably our fault for sleeping in til lunchtime!) But I never heard a peep from any neighbours, so I think the walls between rooms are very well soundproofed. Best thing about the hotel was the location, lovely 10 min walk along the seafront to la ramblas and port vell. very close to barcelonetta metro station which is on a very convienient line. A short walk through cute little old streets to all the major tourist attractions, and a 5 min hop to the beach! The whole area is described as the 'hippest' in barcelona and felt very safe. yes the street outside the hotel is a bit smelly, but lots in the old town are! Overall remarkably good value for money, the hotel is two star mainly duue to its lack of facilities, though it does provide a free breakfast and other meal, though we never tried them. Please do not be put off by bad reviews, i would stay there again, a bargain for £25 per person a night!

Reviews.Title: “Like the Curate's Egg - good in parts...”
Reviews.Author: SusanBJennings
Reviews.Content: If you want a cheap hotel that is extremely close to the main train station, a stone's throw from shops, cafes and bars, and where rooms are cleaned daily, this is the place to stay. If you want light and airy, spacious and well-appointed, with great views and facilities, I'm afraid you're going to draw the short straw, especially if you get to the hotel when the majority of its rooms are full with a coach party of students and you end up at the top/back of the hotel. My partner and I booked a room here through an accommodation website on the net, as we had never been to Barcelona before and wanted a VERY CHEAP place to stay. And for us, the stay was very cheap - the equivalent of £30 a night (for the room, not per person). The Pros: the hotel is literally a two minute walk from the station - even with luggage - and less than a 10 minute walk to the Ramblas, the harbour area, the city's best park, and the main bus stops for the Bus Tourista - the best value way to find out about the city on your first visit - 23 Euros at the time of writing for a two-day ticket. Each room at the hotel has its own bathroom facilities, even if these (in some rooms) are below the standard you would normally expect when staying in, say, a 3 Star hotel in London. The 'baths' are more like 2ft deep shower trays, so forget long soaks. Each room has bedside lights, a dressing table, a wardrobe and a small TV. Again, not up to some people's standards - just the basic channels in Spanish - so don't complain about the lack of Sky Sport. The reception area seems to be manned 24 hours a day, and while the staff I met weren't exactly 'Mr Congeniality', I think the language difficulties didn't help. While I never got to chat in more than a superficially friendly way with any of the staff, they were helpful whenever help was required. The Cons: the hotel is a typical bargain-end Spanish establishment, so yes, people will be hanging around in the bar/dining room, smoking, while having a very relaxed attitude to food hygiene rules. That's what they do: it's Spain. When we arrived, we were given a very small, dark room at the back of the hotel, with which I was prepared to 'make do' until I tripped on a loose fragment of bathroom tile (two or three were damaged). So the next day, I asked if we could move rooms. The chap was a bit 'put out' and said: "Why didn't you say you didn't want the room last night?" Fair comment, I thought, but I explained that a coach-load of students had just turned up, the place was heaving and I didn't want to cause a scene at reception. He shrugged in acknowledgement and after the head housekeeper was sent to the room with us (so that he could find out what was upsetting me), we got our room change. As for the coach-load of students, well some of the little darlings behaved just as you might expect and there were lots of 'technical difficulties' with the lift, while some of the wooden surfaces around the hotel now have charming little carvings, courtesy of the more artistic among them. While other reviewers have talked about shortcomings with some of the equipment /facilities in the rooms, I think, to be fair, a lot of this is down to damage caused by some of the hotel's guests. While I did asked to be moved because of damaged floor tiles, I don't think the hotel can be held responsible for how people behave. And as for comments about people sleeping on the pavement outside the hotel...well I have seen far worse on the streets of London. Like any big city, there is deprivation and hardship, which is always upsetting. But for the four days I stayed in this hotel, I didn't experience any problems immediately outside or around the building, even after dark. I think it is well worth considering this as a cheap, 'no frills' clean, safe base, simply because of where it is in relation to everything you'd want or need in the city during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and filthy”
Reviews.Author: tommytwoone
Reviews.Content: Our party of eight were booked into this hotel after Globespan messed up our origional hotel booking. We arrived to find around fifteen people sleeping on the pavement nearby. There was also a strong smell of sewage comming from a drain just outside the main door. The hotel rooms were small, very shabby and had broken and chipped tiles, our rooms aircon leaked during the night and dripped into ,our suitcase soaking our clothes it was not repaired we had to place our hotel towels on the floor each night and the maid emptied the casing each morning onto the floor and used dirty towels from other rooms to mop up. other reviews mention the same problem with this room 111. Plaster was falling of the walls mildew was on the wall above the doors the bathroom was as clean as could be expected given that the tiles were broken and missing. one of our bed side lamps actualy dangled from its wires. When we went to the breakfast room we found the staff sitting arround smoking and casually handelling the pastries the crockery and cutlery were either chipped and or filthy, we had breakfast. at a cafe round the corner all in all this is a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Dai.Owens
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel for myself and 5 friends who spent three nights there, Was a bit alarmed when I saw some of the reviews but was pleasantly surprised to find the rooms were very clean, staff very helpful, location was excellent, you can get the train from the Station Franca just around the corner to the airport!. Overall I would recommend it for anyone staying for a few nights break.

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers & Loved It ! Will Return”
Reviews.Author: mrchipstakeaway
Reviews.Content: After reading previous comments very unsure. When my wife & I arrived at Barcelona International Airport Taxi driver didnt have a clue 27euros later Santa Marta. Upon checkin Hotel manager had no booking or could not find one, He took our internet booking faxed it off and we were given room 104. Room was small but on suite & very very clean. Bath towels and bedding changed daily. Breakfast between 7 - 10 am very basic continental but what you would expect if still hungry local bars open at 7am and serve breakfast or lunches from 2 euros 300yards away. But what a location Franca main train station 2 miniute walk away 2.40euros to Barcelona airport 20 miniute journey. Cittadell Park 800yards away, Port 8 miniutes away and La Ramblas 15miniutes away Heaven!!!! Some previous comments are most unfair and unjust, Santa Marta is only 2* some previous underwriters should stay and sister hotels that are 3,4, & 5* but oh yeah they would have to pay more. Some it seems want a palace but only pay a bedsit rate. Great stay good hotel no complaints will be returning with our children in the new year.

Reviews.Title: “Well, what can I say about Santa Marta...............”
Reviews.Author: coolibar
Reviews.Content: Everything you've read about this hotel is true - both good and bad. Excellent location, but wouldn't want to spend too much time there. Very small room, but clean and tidy, although felt a bit like the princess and the pea with the beds!!! Was very disappointed with the breakfast. A stale old croissant and a brioche, jams and tea or coffee. Not too impressed with the waiter smoking at the bar area!! BUT, after seeing the funny side of it (Fawlty Towers eat your heart out), and the fact that just up the road you have the Gothic Quarter and Las Ramblas where they sell adequate continental breakfast and lots of other stuff, this is the perfect base if you are on a budget to explore the wonderful, cultural, architectural delights of Barcelona. Don;t be put off - if your monies are tight this is an ok base to explore from............although, once is enough!!!

Reviews.Title: “fine for the the price!”
Reviews.Author: ianbrown82
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel earlier this year, yes thr other reviewers are correct, its not the best hotel, but what more do you want for the price. its in a great location, all the staff i come across in a 6 day stay spoke english, the bathrooms are clean and the showers hot. The bedrooms themselves are not brilliant but if u go to Barcelona you should be spending some more time out and about! I will be going back in a few weeks time and im staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't be that bad!”
Reviews.Author: happyhannah
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend booked into the hotel Santa Marta and made the mistake of reading the reviews only the night before we left for Barcelona- understandably we were a bit nervous. Upon arriving at the hotel however we were told at the reception that we wouldn't be staying at the hotel due to broken air conditioning. Instead we were moved to a nearby 4 star hotel at no extra cost. Although we didn't stay at the Santa Marta we found the location convenient, the receptiion bright and staff friendly. It seemed that if the staff were prepared to move us to a 4 star hotel because of no air conditioning, then the comfort of the guests was a concern and that the Santa Marta can't be that bad afterall!

Reviews.Title: “How did it even get 2*”
Reviews.Author: paulaIbiza
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel i have ever stayed in. It is located down a dark alley.There was mould growing on the walls and beds where damp .staff were nice but that cannot make up for the terrible state of the hotel. Do youself a favour and dont even think about staying here. there are some lovely hotels in barcelona but this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “oh dear, is it too late to book into another hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First impressions count and on this occassion I very nearly chose to book out. Always use this site but on this occassion must not have read the reveiws. I chose thew hotel for its location - which is suberb if you like boats and cheap Tapas bars within walking distance. The foyer was crumbling and the wall paper peeling of the walls. The bedroom was a twin despite asking for a double. the bathroom although clean was so small it was impossible to dry yourself after having a shower. On the up side, if you are on a tight budget and can see past the very tired interior the staff were friendly and the rooms were warm and the showers hot. Did not look too carefully under the beds as thought it wise not to.
